The Most Haunted team head into Ayrshire, Scotland to visit Culzean Castle - home to at least seven ghosts. Derek claims to hear bagpipes playing and is even able to provide a name for the castle's legendary, ghostly piper.

The Most Haunted team travel to Rye, East Sussex to visit one of the oldest and reputedly most haunted pubs in Britain. Reports from guests include a chair that moves by itself and a ghostly duel in one of the bedrooms.

Most Haunted takes a trip to the seaside with a visit to the famous funfair. They investigate claims of a haunted ghost train and poltergeist activity. Derek sees ghostly children in the gift shop and phantom footsteps are heard.

Witchcraft, robbery, murder and human sacrifice are all rumored to have taken place at Treasure Holt on the Essex coast. Derek is guided around the house by the spirit of a monk and contacts two of the ghosts seen there.

Yvette and Jason don 1940s uniforms as the team investigate this London Underground station that served as a WWII air raid shelter. Yvette thinks she sees a figure in the tunnel and a motion detector goes off with no-one there.

The team return to County Offaly in Ireland where they visit Charleville Forest Castle, said to have been built upon an ancient burial ground. The team experience poltergeist activity and hold a Victorian-style séance.

In what was the original pilot episode, the Most Haunted team travel to Hailsham, East Sussex to visit a former priory converted into a house. It is said that many of the families that have lived there have suffered tragedy.
